posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello All,

I'm just looking for a few prods in the right direction for this build, please. When you see my parameters you'll see why it's a build for me to make, rather than you perfectionists, but it all helps in my development, right?

To the bones. I'm looking to build a full L40 PvM creation that is human, male and melee-centric. They are predominantly Barbarian, as rage (or more particularly terrifying rage is key. So far so good. Things start to get a little less optimum around now. He will not be a heavy armour wearer - I can stretch to medium, but light is preferred - and he doesn't do shields (great for AC, I know). He's not even that fond of two-handed weapons or dual-wield, but I think I can get around that - though not without problems, for while his weapon of choice is probably bastard sword (I have some flexibility there, thank goodness), he does carry plenty of knives. Oh, and he's STR and DEX focused, with as much CON as I can squeeze in - fortunately, he's not a spell-chucker.

So, at the moment I'm thinking a Barbarian/Ranger split of about 31/9, but I'm aware that i) best guidance tends to be that if 2 classes makes it better, 3 makes it more so, and ii) I believe Tumble would be a good skill for him. This all inclines me to chuck some Rogue, or possibly Bard at him. And now I get confused: is it better for me to drop Ranger (which would only be there for Dual-wield/Imp 2 weapon fighting, given the armour impositions), and load more Rogue/Bard; or would the cost of Ambidexterity and 2 weapon fighting be too high?

I've got myself into a bit of a tizzy over this, so I thought I'd ask for advice. Hope you don't mind.

Thanks in advance - and sorry (bloody role-players, eh!)

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
I am by no means a power builder, but in my mind, I see your toon as a Dex-based Ranger 21/Barbarian 15/Harper Scout 4

Ranger not only gives you the dual wield feats, but also 2d6+5 extra damage against 5 races. Barb, of course, gives your Terrifying Rage and Harper gives you tumble. You get stackable Cat's Grace from Ranger and Harper, as well. Iron Will + Tymora's Smile give you some mind resistance.

Bastard Sword is out for a dexer, however, but Rapier and Dagger (or Kukri) could be wicked against favored enemies.

You could do that combo STR based with a Bastard Sword, but with light armor and no shield . . . even with full tumble you;ll be moderately easy pickings.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Many thanks - I hadn't even thought about Harper Scout (forgot it even existed, truth be known). I'll see if I can get away with rapier, as your reasoning does make a lot of sense. I shall get back to you...

Thanks again

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: The extra feat that Humans get can be used for exotic weapons proficiency, but you'd lose 2 points starting DEX, and so you would have to boost DEX instead of STR 2 times to get enough DEX for Epic Dodge. Since Valerfor never tels us when to boost what ability, I don't know whether that would result in having to delay Epic Dodge, but I do know that your AB would be -1 from the loss of 2 STR. On the plus side, you will get +2 CON, so you get more health and +1 on Fortitude saves.
